description: John George Brown is a British-born American painter known for his genre scenes, particularly depictions of New York street urchins, and his presidency of the Water-Color Society.

mainEvents.description: Became president of the Water-Color Society

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1907 seems to capture the moment when John George Brown, at the age of 76, was still actively painting, having achieved great success as a painter of genre scenes and as a president of the Water-Color Society.
title: John George Brown
name: John George Brown

description: Abbott Handerson Thayer is a prominent American artist and naturalist recognized for his 'angel' paintings, contributions to camouflage theory, and influence on American art through his teaching.

mainEvents.description: Major exhibition of his work at the Carnegie Institute

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1920 seems to capture the moment when Thayer, despite his age, was still actively pursuing his artistic and scientific interests, particularly in camouflage, a field he pioneered.
title: Abbott Handerson Thayer Self-Portrait
name: Abbott Handerson Thayer

description: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt is a 19th-century American author best known for her book Flora's Dictionary, which introduced the concept of a language of flowers to a wide American audience.

mainEvents.description: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt was born.
Wirt was credited as author of Flora's Dictionary.
Wirt's husband died, and she moved to Florida.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1809-10 seems to capture the moment when Elizabeth was a young, recently married woman, shortly after her wedding to William Wirt, but before she was well known for her authorship and her many children.
title: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt
name: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt

description: William Bainbridge is a renowned United States Navy officer who served in several wars, including the Quasi-War, the First Barbary War, and the War of 1812, earning recognition for his naval victories.

mainEvents.description: Bainbridge served as Commander of the USS Retaliation, which was captured by two French frigates.
The USS Philadelphia, commanded by Bainbridge, was lost and he was captured.
The USS Constitution, under Bainbridge's command, captures HMS Java.
Bainbridge commanded a squadron during the Second Barbary War.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1814 seems to capture the moment when William Bainbridge, now a seasoned naval commander, was at the height of his career, fresh from his victory against the HMS Java in the War of 1812.
title: William Bainbridge
name: William Bainbridge

description: George Henry Durrie is a renowned American landscape painter, celebrated for his captivating rural winter snow scenes that gained widespread popularity through lithographic prints by Currier and Ives.

mainEvents.description: Began painting water and snow scenes
Currier and Ives published first of Durrie's prints

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1843 seems to capture the moment when George Henry Durrie was transitioning from portraiture to landscape painting, having recently begun to create captivating winter scenes that would define his career.
title: George Henry Durrie Self-Portrait
name: George Henry Durrie

description: William Baxter Palmer Closson is a noted American painter known for his landscapes and portraits, recognized for his meticulous detail and harmonious use of color. He also excelled at wood engravings, contributing to prominent publications.

mainEvents.description: Started working as a wood engraver for Samuel Smith Kilburn.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900? seems to capture the moment when William Baxter Palmer Closson, a renowned artist, was at the peak of his artistic career, having honed his skills as a painter and wood engraver.
title: William Closson Self-Portrait
name: William Baxter Palmer Closson

description: William Linn is a prominent figure in American history, serving as the first Chaplain of the United States House of Representatives and the second President of Queen's College (now Rutgers University). He was a Presbyterian minister who played a significant role in the development of higher education and the early American government.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from the College of New Jersey (now Princeton University)
Appointed Chaplain of the Continental Army
Elected as the first Chaplain of the United States House of Representatives
Appointed President pro tempore of Queen's College

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1805 seems to capture the moment when William Linn was at the height of his career as a Presbyterian minister, having served as the first Chaplain of the House of Representatives and as the President pro tempore of Queen's College. He was a prominent figure in the religious and educational spheres, and this portrait reflects his stature and influence.
title: William Linn
name: William Linn

description: Elisha Tyson is a prominent figure in the abolitionist movement known for his unwavering commitment to ending slavery. He was a Quaker philanthropist who actively supported enslaved people through practical means, including establishing safe houses on the Underground Railroad and purchasing freedom for many.

mainEvents.description: Founded Maryland Society for the Abolition of Slavery

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1823 seems to capture the moment when Elisha Tyson, a successful miller and businessman, was at the height of his influence and dedication to the abolitionist cause. Having established himself as a vocal advocate against slavery, he was actively involved in both the Underground Railroad and the African colonization movement.
title: Elisha Tyson
name: Elisha Tyson

description: Charlotte Saunders Cushman is a renowned American stage actress known for her powerful contralto voice and her ability to portray both male and female roles, gaining fame for her dramatic interpretations of Shakespearean characters.

mainEvents.description: Cushman and her sister Susan perform Romeo and Juliet
Cushman moves to Rome and lives in an expatriate community
Cushman meets sculptor Emma Stebbins and begins a relationship

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1836 seems to capture the moment when Charlotte Saunders Cushman was on the verge of her meteoric rise to fame, having just made her dramatic debut as Lady Macbeth, which solidified her status as a major theatrical force.
title: Charlotte Cushman
name: Charlotte Saunders Cushman

description: Charles Willson Peale is a renowned American artist, soldier, scientist, inventor, politician, and naturalist, known for his portraits of notable figures of the late 18th century and his founding of the Philadelphia Museum.

mainEvents.description: Charles Willson Peale was born in Chester, Maryland.
Peale moved to Philadelphia and joined the Sons of Liberty.
Peale founded the Philadelphia Museum, one of America's first museums.
Peale painted 'Washington at Princeton', which later sold for a record price.
Peale designed the first state seal of Maryland.
Charles Willson Peale died in Philadelphia.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1791 seems to capture the moment when Charles Willson Peale was a successful artist, having established himself in Philadelphia and gained recognition for his portraits of prominent figures. This period was just before the founding of the Philadelphia Museum, which would solidify his legacy.
title: Charles Willson Peale Self-Portrait
name: Charles Willson Peale

description: William Page is a prominent 19th-century American painter known for his portraits, particularly those of notable figures like Ulysses S. Grant, and his experimentation with various styles.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1830 seems to capture the moment when William Page, a young artist in his late teens, had just begun to make a name for himself in New York, showing promise and talent.
title: William Page Self-Portrait
name: William Page

description: Alexander Graham Bell is a Scottish-born Canadian-American inventor, scientist, and engineer best known for his invention of the first practical telephone.

mainEvents.description: Bell's first patent for the telephone was issued.
Bell founded the Bell Telephone Company.
Bell's first public demonstration of the telephone occurred.
Bell made the first ceremonial transcontinental telephone call.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1919 seems to capture the moment when Alexander Graham Bell was a renowned inventor and scientist,  already enjoying success with his telephone and several other innovations, but also remaining active in scientific and engineering pursuits.
title: Alexander Graham Bell
name: Alexander Graham Bell

description: Adolfo Müller-Ury is a Swiss-born American portrait painter known for his portraits of prominent figures like Kaiser Wilhelm II and President William McKinley, as well as his impressionistic rose still lifes.

mainEvents.description: Moved to New York City, where he gained prominence as a portraitist.
Painted the portrait of Kaiser Wilhelm II of Germany.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1933 seems to capture the moment when Müller-Ury had recently returned to New York after a period in California, his impressionistic style was fully developed, and he was continuing to paint prominent figures.  He had built his reputation as a sought-after portraitist of the wealthy and powerful.
title: Adolfo Müller-Ury Self-portrait
name: Adolfo Müller-Ury

description: George Fuller is a prominent American figure and portrait painter known for his evocative portrayals of rural life, particularly in the American South, and his exploration of themes of human emotion and spirituality.

mainEvents.description: Fuller began painting portraits in northern New York.
Fuller enrolled in the National Academy of Design
His farm failed and he focused on painting.
Fuller's first art exhibition in New York.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in before 1860 seems to capture the moment when George Fuller was still an aspiring artist, having begun painting portraits in northern New York after overcoming his parents' opposition to his artistic aspirations.  His early travels in the south and his experiences as an itinerant painter, painting portraits and scenes of local life, likely influenced the subject matter and style of this portrait.
title: George Fuller Self-Portrait
name: George Fuller

description: Frederick William MacMonnies is a renowned American sculptor and painter who was particularly known for his work in the Beaux-Arts style, earning acclaim both in France and the United States.

mainEvents.description: Born in Brooklyn Heights, New York
Studied at the École des Beaux-Arts in Paris
Opened a studio in Paris and began creating famous sculptures
Created the Columbian Fountain for the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition
Designed the equestrian statue of Henry Warner Slocum

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1885-1900 seems to capture the moment when Frederick William MacMonnies was rising to prominence as a sculptor, having already begun his apprenticeship under Saint-Gaudens and studied at the École des Beaux-Arts. He would soon go on to create some of his most famous sculptures, including the Columbian Fountain and the Nathan Hale memorial.
title: Frederick William MacMonnies Self-Portrait
name: Frederick William MacMonnies

description: Louis Michel Eilshemius is a self-taught American artist who gained notoriety for his unconventional landscapes, nudes, and his eccentric personality, but received little recognition during his lifetime.

mainEvents.description: Studied at the Art Students League of New York
Studied with Bouguereau at the Académie Julian in Paris
Returned to New York City and lived there for the rest of his life

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1915 seems to capture the moment when Eilshemius was gaining recognition, as he was discovered by Marcel Duchamp a few years prior and exhibited in Paris, but was still struggling to be accepted by the art world.
title: Louis Michel Eilshemius Self-Portrait
name: Louis Michel Eilshemius

description: Carl Wimar is a German-American painter best known for his depictions of Native American life on the Great Plains and the westward expansion of the United States, particularly his detailed portrayals of buffalo hunts and emigrant wagon trains.

mainEvents.description: Carl Wimar was born in Siegburg, Germany
Wimar immigrated to the United States with his family
He began studying painting with Leon Pomarede.
Wimar traveled up the Mississippi River
He studied at the Düsseldorf Academy under Emanuel Leutze
Wimar returned to St. Louis, Missouri
He died in St. Louis, Missouri

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1850-62 seems to capture the moment when Carl Wimar was developing his distinctive style and gaining recognition for his paintings of Native American life, shortly after returning to St. Louis from his studies in Düsseldorf.
title: Carl Wimar Self-Portrait
name: Carl Wimar

description: Robert Richford Roberts is a prominent figure in American Methodism, serving as a circuit rider, pastor, presiding elder, and bishop. He is notable for being the first married man to be elected bishop of the Methodist Episcopal Church.

mainEvents.description: Appointed presiding elder of the Schuylkill District

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1840 seems to capture the moment when Roberts was at the height of his influence as a bishop, having established himself as a leader in the Methodist Church and advocating for missions throughout the United States.
title: Robert Richford Roberts
name: Robert Richford Roberts

description: Gilbert Stuart is a prominent American portraitist of the late 18th and early 19th centuries, known for his iconic portraits of George Washington and other prominent figures.

mainEvents.description: Moved to Scotland with Cosmo Alexander
Moved to England to pursue painting
Became a protégé of Benjamin West

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1825 seems to capture the moment when Gilbert Stuart, a seasoned and celebrated artist, was at the peak of his career, having established himself as a renowned portraitist and gaining recognition for his iconic depictions of American leaders.
title: Gilbert Stuart
name: Gilbert Stuart

description: John Quincy Adams Ward is a prominent American sculptor known for his monumental public sculptures, including the George Washington statue at Federal Hall and The Pilgrim in Central Park. He was a leading figure in the development of an American school of sculpture.

mainEvents.description: John Quincy Adams Ward is born
Ward completes the George Washington monument.
Ward begins teaching sculpture at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
Ward becomes president of the National Sculpture Society.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1868 seems to capture the moment when Ward was at the peak of his career, having already established himself with notable works like the Indian Hunter and the Ether Monument. He was just a few years away from the completion of his iconic George Washington monument.
title: John Quincy Adams Ward
name: John Quincy Adams Ward

description: Charles Wilkes is a prominent American naval officer and explorer, known for his leadership of the United States Exploring Expedition, a significant voyage of scientific discovery in the 19th century.

mainEvents.description: Led the United States Exploring Expedition
Commanded USS San Jacinto during the Trent Affair

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1870 seems to capture the moment when Charles Wilkes, retired from the Navy after a distinguished career, was still reflecting on his achievements, particularly the groundbreaking United States Exploring Expedition, and his controversial role in the Trent Affair.
title: Charles Wilkes
name: Charles Wilkes

description: Francis Asbury is a British-American Methodist minister and one of the first two bishops of the Methodist Episcopal Church in the United States known for his extensive travels and dedication to spreading Methodism.

mainEvents.description: Born in Hamstead Bridge, Staffordshire, England
Began traveling to British North America as a preacher
Ordained as a bishop of the Methodist Episcopal Church
Preached his last sermon in Richmond, Virginia

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1813 seems to capture the moment when Francis Asbury was at the height of his ministry, having achieved significant growth in the Methodist church, but also facing the beginnings of failing health, foreshadowing the end of his preaching journey.
title: Francis Asbury
name: Francis Asbury

description: Ernest Lawson is a Canadian-American painter known for his landscapes and urban scenes, influenced by Impressionism and realism, and a member of The Eight, a group of artists who protested against the National Academy of Design's conservatism.

mainEvents.description: Enrolled at the Art Students League in New York
Studied at the Académie Julian in Paris
Exhibited at the Salon in Paris
First solo exhibition at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when Ernest Lawson, after gaining recognition as a landscape painter and as a member of The Eight, continued to develop his own aesthetic, exploring a range of subjects from urban scenes to natural landscapes.
title: Ernest Lawson
name: Ernest Lawson

description: Alfred Bult Mullett is a British-American architect who served as Supervising Architect of the U.S. Treasury Department from 1866 to 1874, overseeing design and construction of federal buildings across the nation.

mainEvents.description: Emigrated to Glendale, Ohio with his family
Appointed as Supervising Architect of the U.S. Treasury Department
Designed the Old Executive Office Building in Washington, D.C.
Died by suicide in Washington, D.C.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1880-82 seems to capture the moment when Alfred Bult Mullett was in the midst of his private architectural practice after resigning from his government post, reflecting a period of both personal and professional challenges.
title: Alfred Bult Mullett
name: Alfred Bult Mullett

description: Daniel Huntington is a prominent American painter known for his landscapes in the Hudson River School style and later for his portraiture.

mainEvents.description: Studied with Samuel F.B. Morse at Yale
First exhibition at the National Academy of Design
President of the National Academy of Design
President of the National Academy of Design again

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Huntington was already a recognized artist, having established himself with "Mercy's Dream", but before he shifted his focus primarily to portraiture.
title: Daniel Huntington
name: Daniel Huntington

description: Lester Wallack is a renowned American actor-manager who established a legacy in the American theatre through his performances, management of the Wallack's Theatre, and contributions to theatrical organizations.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1866 seems to capture the moment when Lester Wallack was at the height of his career, having established his own theatre and gained recognition for his performances in comedic and romantic roles.
title: Lester Wallack
name: Lester Wallack

description: Edward Hicks is a notable Quaker minister and folk artist known for his "Peaceable Kingdom" paintings, which depict a utopian vision of peace and harmony between humans and animals.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1839 seems to capture the moment when Edward Hicks was a well-established and respected Quaker minister and artist, known for his "Peaceable Kingdom" paintings, which reflected his Quaker beliefs in peace and harmony.
title: Edward Hicks Painting the Peaceable Kingdom
name: Edward Hicks

description: Anson Phelps Stokes is a prominent American educator, historian, clergyman, author, philanthropist, and civil rights activist known for his involvement in Yale University, the Phelps Stokes Fund, and the National Cathedral.

mainEvents.description: Born in New Brighton, Staten Island, New York
Became resident canon at the National Cathedral
Published a biography of Booker T. Washington

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1900 seems to capture the moment when Anson Phelps Stokes was a rising figure in academia, having recently taken the post of Secretary of Yale University. He was known for his scholarship and his interest in social and religious issues.
title: Anson Phelps Stokes
name: Anson Phelps Stokes

description: George Inness is a highly influential 19th-century American landscape painter, known for his atmospheric and emotional works that often juxtaposed realistic details with hazy or blurred elements, reflecting the fusion of the physical and spiritual.

mainEvents.description: First trip to Europe to paint and study
Elected to the National Academy of Design
First studio in New York City
Major retrospective organized by the American Art Association
Died in Bridge of Allan, Scotland

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1890-1928 seems to capture the moment when Inness was at the peak of his career, having received international acclaim for his unique style and having developed a deeply personal approach to landscape painting, one that reflects his interest in spiritual and emotional themes.
title: George Inness
name: George Inness

description: Varina Howell Davis is a prominent figure in American history, known as the only First Lady of the Confederate States of America and the wife of President Jefferson Davis.

mainEvents.description: Varina Howell Davis married Jefferson Davis.
Varina Howell Davis moved to Richmond, Virginia.
Varina Howell Davis became First Lady of the Confederacy.
The Confederate States of America surrendered to the Union.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849 seems to capture the moment when Varina Howell Davis was still relatively young and had recently married Jefferson Davis, before the complexities and hardships of the Civil War.
title: Varina Howell Davis
name: Varina Howell Davis

description: Valentine Mott is a renowned American surgeon who made significant contributions to the field of surgery, particularly in the areas of ligature of the innominate and carotid arteries.

mainEvents.description: Born in Glen Cove, New York
Appointed Professor of Surgery at Columbia College
Successfully performed the first carotid artery ligation in the USA
Founded the University Medical College of New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1820 seems to capture the moment when Valentine Mott was establishing himself as a prominent surgeon, having already made important contributions to the field, and on the cusp of a career that would see him achieve even greater recognition.
title: Valentine Mott
name: Valentine Mott

description: Margery Winifred Williams Bianco is a celebrated English-American author known for her endearing children's stories, most notably "The Velveteen Rabbit." Her works often explore themes of love, loss, and the power of imagination.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when Margery Williams Bianco, a young and ambitious writer, was beginning to gain recognition for her literary skills. It was a time when her career was in its early stages, yet she was already developing the style and themes that would become synonymous with her work.
title: Margery Williams
name: Margery Winifred Williams Bianco

description: Daniel Leonard is a prominent lawyer from colonial Massachusetts, known for his staunch Loyalist views during the American Revolution. He was a vocal supporter of the British Crown, even as his fellow colonists were growing increasingly dissatisfied with British rule.

mainEvents.description: Fled to Boston with the British
Served as Chief Justice of Bermuda

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1770 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Leonard, a rising legal figure, found himself caught in the growing political turmoil of the colonies. As a committed Loyalist, he was likely grappling with the implications of the mounting tensions between the colonists and the British Crown.
title: Daniel Leonard
name: Daniel Leonard

description: Joseph Galloway is a prominent American Loyalist during the American Revolution, known for his opposition to independence and his influential role in the British government.

mainEvents.description: Proposed a plan for Union at the First Continental Congress
Fled to New York to join the British
Appointed Superintendent of Police in Philadelphia
Escaped to England and convicted of high treason

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1775 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Galloway was a rising star in Pennsylvania politics, a prominent lawyer, and speaker of the House, just before his break with the Continental Congress and the start of his Loyalist activities.
title: Joseph Galloway
name: Joseph Galloway

description: John Bradstreet is a British Army officer who served in King George's War, the French and Indian War, and Pontiac's War. He also served as the Commodore-Governor for Newfoundland.

mainEvents.description: Born in Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia
Awarded lieutenant-colonel of the 1st Massachusetts Regiment
Led an unsuccessful relief column to Fort Oswego
Led the advance guard at the Battle of Carillon

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1764 seems to capture the moment when John Bradstreet is at the height of his military career, having just been appointed colonel and leading a force to reinforce Fort Detroit against Pontiac's uprising.
title: General John Bradstreet
name: John Bradstreet

description: William Linn is a Presbyterian minister and the second President of Queen's College, now Rutgers University, and the first Chaplain of the United States House of Representatives.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from the College of New Jersey
Became a Chaplain in the Continental Army
Elected as the first Chaplain of the U.S. House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in early 1790s seems to capture the moment when William Linn, having served as a chaplain during the Revolution, was at the height of his career, serving as President of Queen's College and as the first Chaplain of the U.S. House of Representatives.
title: William Linn
name: William Linn

description: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson is a prominent historical figure, known as the second wife of President Woodrow Wilson and the First Lady of the United States from 1915 to 1921, who gained notable influence during her husband's presidency.

mainEvents.description: Married Norman Galt, a prominent jeweler.
Became the First Lady of the United States.
Woodrow Wilson suffered a severe stroke.
Assumed a prominent role in managing President Wilson's administration.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1924 seems to capture the moment when Edith Bolling Wilson was deeply involved in managing her husband's presidency after his stroke, a role she described as 'stewardship,' demonstrating her strength and resilience during a challenging period.
title: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson
name: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson

description: John Henry Patterson is a pioneering industrialist, founder of the National Cash Register Company, known for innovative business practices and relief efforts after the 1913 Dayton flood.

mainEvents.description: Convicted of violating Sherman Antitrust Act
Led relief efforts for Great Dayton Flood

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1920 seems to capture the moment when John Henry Patterson was at the peak of his career, having weathered the antitrust convictions and led the flood relief efforts, solidifying his legacy as a forward-thinking business leader and philanthropist.
title: John Henry Patterson
name: John Henry Patterson

description: Elisha Kent Kane is a prominent 19th-century American Arctic explorer and naval surgeon, best known for his two expeditions in search of the lost Franklin expedition and his significant contributions to Arctic exploration and scientific knowledge.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from the University of Pennsylvania Medical School

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1857 seems to capture the moment when Elisha Kent Kane, having recently returned from his second Arctic expedition, is recognized as a national hero and celebrated for his scientific achievements and explorations, while also facing declining health.
title: Elisha Kent Kane
name: Elisha Kent Kane

description: Samuel Ringgold is a noted artillery officer in the United States Army, known for his military innovations that earned him the title 'Father of Modern Artillery'. He made significant contributions to artillery tactics and was tragically killed in the Mexican-American War.

mainEvents.description: Fought at Battle of Palo Alto

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1825 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Ringgold was on the staff of General Winfield Scott, showcasing his rising military career and contributions to artillery before his tragic fate in the Mexican-American War.
title: Samuel Ringgold
name: Samuel Ringgold

description: Charles Nagel is a prominent American lawyer, politician, and corporate attorney who served as Secretary of Commerce and Labor under President William Howard Taft, and was a key founder of the United States Chamber of Commerce.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from Washington University School of Law
Elected to the Missouri House of Representatives
Served as President of the St. Louis City Council
Appointed Secretary of Commerce and Labor

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1901 seems to capture the moment when Charles Nagel was at the height of his legal career in St. Louis, having served as President of the city council and was gaining national recognition for his work as a corporate attorney.
title: Charles Nagel
name: Charles Nagel

description: John Summerfield is a Methodist clergyman, born in England in 1798, who became a renowned preacher in Ireland and the United States, known for his eloquence and missionary work, and is most remembered for his early death at the age of 27.

mainEvents.description: Imprisoned in Dublin due to dissipation
Preaches to large congregations in Dublin
Moves to New York, admitted to Methodist conference

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1821-25 seems to capture the moment when John Summerfield, having overcome his youthful difficulties, was establishing himself as a powerful and influential preacher in the United States.
title: John Summerfield
name: John Summerfield

description: Carter Braxton is a Founding Father, a signer of the Declaration of Independence, a merchant, and a Virginia planter, known for his long political career and for his wealth from his inheritance and trading activities.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the Virginia House of Burgesses

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1775 seems to capture the moment when Carter Braxton was a seasoned legislator, a successful merchant, and a wealthy planter, balancing his conservative leanings with the growing tide of revolutionary sentiment.
title: Carter Braxton
name: Carter Braxton

description: Sidney Hillman is a prominent American labor leader who spearheaded the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, significantly contributing to the establishment of the Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO) and labor's support for President Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal.

mainEvents.description: Hillman was born in Žagarė, Lithuania.
Hillman led the first May Day march in Kovno.
Hillman founded the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America.
The Amalgamated survived a four-month lockout in New York City.
Hillman played a key role in establishing the CIO.
Hillman became the head of the War Production Board's labor division.
Hillman died of a heart attack at age 59.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Hillman had solidified his role as a leading labor leader and advocate for the New Deal, just as the CIO was being established as a major force in American labor, though Lewis's defection from the CIO was still years away.
title: Sidney Hillman
name: Sidney Hillman

description: Joseph Jefferson is a renowned American actor and author who gained fame for his portrayal of Rip Van Winkle on stage and in early silent film adaptations. He was a member of a family of actors and continued performing for most of his life.

mainEvents.description: Jefferson's first recorded performance was at the Washington Theatre.
He performed at the Franklin theatre in New York City.
He was one of the founding members of the Actors' Order of Friendship.
Jefferson debuted as Asa Trenchard in Tom Taylor's Our American Cousin.
Joseph Jefferson died at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1871 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Jefferson was at the height of his career. Having performed his most famous character of Rip Van Winkle on stage both in America and London, he had recently returned to America where he would continue to tour with this play for decades.
title: Joseph Jefferson
name: Joseph Jefferson

description: Sarah Porter is a pioneering American educator who founded Miss Porter's School, a renowned private college preparatory school for girls.  She championed academic excellence and physical activity for her students, establishing a legacy of educational innovation.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1896 seems to capture the moment when Sarah Porter, nearing the end of her long and impactful career, was still actively shaping the lives of young women, advocating for their intellectual and physical growth, and leaving a lasting mark on American education.
title: Sarah Porter
name: Sarah Porter

description: Horatio Greenough is a prominent American sculptor known for his classical style, government commissions, and his contributions to architectural theory.

mainEvents.description: Horatio Greenough was born in Boston.
He created his first known statue of William Penn.
He sailed to Rome to study art and created many busts.
Greenough completed the sculpture The Rescue.
Horatio Greenough died in Somerville, Massachusetts.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1829 seems to capture the moment when Horatio Greenough, a young and ambitious sculptor, was establishing himself as a prominent artist in Florence, Italy, following his return from Rome, where he had immersed himself in the study of classical art.
title: Horatio Greenough
name: Horatio Greenough

description: John Howard Raymond is a prominent 19th-century American educator known for his roles as president of the Polytechnic Institute of New York University and Vassar College.

mainEvents.description: Became professor of rhetoric and English literature at Madison University
Became president of Polytechnic Institute of New York University

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1845 seems to capture the moment when John Howard Raymond, a respected educator and orator, was at the peak of his career at Madison University, where he was already known for his teaching and public speaking.
title: John Howard Raymond
name: John Howard Raymond

description: Richard Watson Gilder is a prominent American poet and editor, known for his influence on The Century Magazine and his contributions to the literary world during the Gilded Age.

mainEvents.description: Enlisted in the American Civil War
Became editor of Hours at Home

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1902-03 seems to capture the moment when Richard Watson Gilder was at the peak of his influence as editor of The Century Magazine, having established it as a leading voice in American literature and culture.
title: Richard Watson Gilder
name: Richard Watson Gilder

description: Robert Hare is a pioneering American chemist known for his invention of the oxy-hydrogen blowpipe, his work on voltaic batteries, and his later interest in spiritualism.

mainEvents.description: Robert Hare was born in Philadelphia.
Hare developed and experimented with the oxy-hydrogen blowpipe.
Hare was elected a member of the American Philosophical Society.
Hare was a professor at the University of Pennsylvania.
Hare invented the "galvanic deflagrator", a type of voltaic battery.
Hare was elected an Associate Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1856 seems to capture the moment when Robert Hare, a prominent scientist at the University of Pennsylvania, was becoming increasingly interested in the study of Spiritualism.
title: Robert Hare
name: Robert Hare

description: Gilbert Stuart is a prominent American portrait painter of the late 18th and early 19th centuries, renowned for his iconic depictions of prominent figures including George Washington and the first six presidents of the United States. He is known for his direct approach to painting, often beginning directly on the canvas without sketches, and his ability to capture the likeness and personality of his subjects. Stuart left a lasting legacy on American art through his masterful portraits that continue to be celebrated today.

mainEvents.description: Moved to England to pursue his painting career
Became a protégé of Benjamin West
Painted 'The Skater', a portrait of Sir William Grant
Returned to the United States and settled in Philadelphia
Painted iconic portraits of George Washington

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1825 seems to capture the moment when Gilbert Stuart, despite suffering a stroke two years earlier, was still actively painting and enjoying recognition for his prolific career. He was at an age when he had cemented his reputation as one of America's leading portraitists, having painted numerous prominent figures and becoming especially famous for his iconic depictions of George Washington.
title: Gilbert Stuart
name: Gilbert Stuart

description: Henry Ward Ranger is a prominent American landscape and marine painter who founded the Old Lyme Art Colony, known for its distinctive Tonalist style.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1897-1928 seems to capture the moment when Ranger, having achieved success in Europe and New York, had established himself as a leader in the Tonalist movement and was beginning to explore the influence of Impressionism.
title: Henry Ward Ranger
name: Henry Ward Ranger

description: William Morris Hunt is a prominent American painter of the 19th century known for his landscapes and portraits, a pioneer of the Barbizon School in America, and a significant figure in New England's art scene.

mainEvents.description: Studied in Paris under Thomas Couture.
Influenced by Millet's 'The Sower' at the Paris Salon.
Elected to the National Academy of Design.
Many works destroyed in the Great Boston Fire.
Died in the Isles of Shoals, New Hampshire.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1850 seems to capture the moment when William Morris Hunt, having studied under Couture in Paris, is beginning to develop his own style, influenced by the Barbizon School and Jean-François Millet, a period before he gained recognition as Boston's leading portrait and landscape painter.
title: William Morris Hunt
name: William Morris Hunt

description: Henry Kirke Brown is a renowned American sculptor known for his equestrian statues, particularly the George Washington statue in Union Square, New York City, and his significant works in the National Statuary Hall.

mainEvents.description: Traveled to Italy for artistic studies
Elected into the National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Henry Kirke Brown was at the height of his career, having already established himself as a leading sculptor in America, with several notable works completed, and the Lincoln statue soon to be unveiled.
title: Henry Kirke Brown
name: Henry Kirke Brown

description: William James is a prominent American philosopher and psychologist, known for founding pragmatism, functional psychology, and radical empiricism. He wrote influential works like 'The Principles of Psychology' and 'The Varieties of Religious Experience', and challenged traditional philosophical thought with his focus on practical consequences and personal experience.

mainEvents.description: William James started his studies at Harvard.
He taught his first psychology course.
He published 'The Varieties of Religious Experience'.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1859 seems to capture the moment when William James was a young man, still in the early stages of his academic career, but already showing the intellectual curiosity and passion for knowledge that would later define his life's work.
title: William James
name: William James

description: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon is a prominent American-born Vicereine of India, known for her lavish lifestyle, influence on fashion, and contributions to social and medical reforms during her time in India.

mainEvents.description: Contributed to the design of Queen Alexandra's coronation robe
Visited Kaziranga area in search of rhinoceros

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1901 seems to capture the moment when Lady Curzon was at the height of her social influence, having recently organized the Delhi Durbar and established herself as a prominent figure in the British imperial court, while also showcasing her elegant style and fashion sense.
title: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon
name: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon

description: Frank Duveneck is a prominent American painter known for his dark, realistic style and his impact on the American art movement, particularly in the 1870s, where his work helped overturn the traditions of the Hudson River School.

His wife, Elizabeth Boott, died in Paris
Returned to America and taught at the Art Academy of Cincinnati

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1890 seems to capture the moment when Duveneck, in his early 40s, had achieved significant recognition for his work, after the tragic loss of his wife in 1888, and as he was beginning his career as a prominent teacher at the Art Academy of Cincinnati.
title: Frank Duveneck Self-Portrait
name: Frank Duveneck

description: Henry Mosler is a German-born American painter who documented American life, including colonial themes, Civil War illustrations, and portraits of men and women of society.

Studied at the Royal Academy in Düsseldorf
Exhibited his first major work, "The Lost Cause", at the National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1907 seems to capture the moment when Henry Mosler was at the height of his career, having achieved international recognition for his paintings and having moved to New York City to continue his artistic journey.

name: Henry Mosler

description: Matthew Pratt is a Colonial Era American artist known for his portraits of prominent figures, including those of Benjamin West and Thomas Paine.  He also painted scenes of daily life in Philadelphia, making him a significant contributor to the development of American art.

mainEvents.description: Traveled to England as pupil of Benjamin West

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1764 seems to capture the moment when Matthew Pratt had just returned from England, where he had been a student of Benjamin West. He had honed his skills under West's tutelage and would soon establish himself as a leading portrait painter in Philadelphia.
title: Matthew Pratt Self-Portrait
name: Matthew Pratt

description: George Gershwin is a prolific American composer and pianist whose iconic works spanned genres, including jazz, classical, and popular music, leaving an indelible mark on American culture.

mainEvents.description: Released the opera Porgy and Bess

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1934 seems to capture the moment when George Gershwin was at the peak of his creative powers, having recently completed the groundbreaking opera Porgy and Bess and amidst working on other projects, showcasing his versatility and continued influence on music.

name: George Gershwin

description: William Dunlap is a prominent figure in American theater history, known for his contributions as a playwright, actor, producer, and historian. He also pursued painting, notably creating a portrait of George Washington, despite losing an eye in his youth.

Studied under Benjamin West in London
Founded the National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1805 seems to capture the moment when Dunlap, having managed the Park Theatre for seven years, was transitioning away from theater management to focus more on his painting career, having resumed painting out of economic necessity in 1805.
title: William Dunlap self-portrait
name: William Dunlap

description: William Auerbach-Levy is a Belarusian-born American artist known for his paintings, etchings, and caricatures, particularly those of celebrities and theatrical personalities.

Elected into the National Academy of Design as an Associate.
Became a full member of the National Academy of Design.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1912 seems to capture the moment when William Auerbach-Levy was well established as a caricaturist, having already published books on the subject and contributing to publications like The New Yorker and Vanity Fair, but still actively working and developing his art.
title: William Auerbach-Levy Self-Portrait
name: William Auerbach-Levy

description: Rubens Peale is a significant figure in American art and museum history, known for his role as a museum administrator and, later in life, as a still-life painter.

mainEvents.description: Travels to the United Kingdom with his family.
Becomes director of the Philadelphia Museum
Runs the Peale Museum in Baltimore with his brother.
Opens his own museum in New York.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1807 seems to capture the moment when Rubens Peale was in his early twenties, having recently returned from his travels with his family and just beginning to explore his own career path. title: Rubens Peale
name: Rubens Peale

description: Benjamin Silliman is a pioneering American chemist and educator known for founding the American Journal of Science, the first science lectures at Yale, and the analysis of an early American meteorite.

First analysis of an American meteorite.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1825 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin Silliman was at the height of his career as a renowned chemist and science educator, having established himself as a leading figure in American science with the founding of the American Journal of Science, the first science lectures at Yale, and his groundbreaking work on the analysis of an early American meteorite.

name: Benjamin Silliman

description: Benjamin West is a renowned British-American artist famous for his historical paintings depicting scenes from British history, particularly the American Revolution, and for being a founding member and President of the Royal Academy.

Appointed Historical Painter to the Court
Founded the Royal Academy of Arts
Elected President of the Royal Academy

description: George Caleb Bingham is a renowned American artist known for his depictions of frontier life and political scenes in Missouri during the mid-19th century.

Traveled to Europe with second wife

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1849-50 seems to capture the moment when Bingham's career as an artist was blossoming, his political influence was rising, and he was beginning to explore themes of westward expansion and democratic ideals in his art.

description: Arvid Frederick Nyholm is a Swedish-American artist, known primarily for his portrait and landscape paintings. He was a student of Anders Zorn and exhibited widely in the United States and Sweden.

description: Edmund Charles Tarbell is a prominent American Impressionist painter, a member of the Ten American Painters, known for his richly hued images of figures in landscapes and his mastery of light and tone.

mainEvents.description: Entered the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Returned to Boston to begin his career
His painting 'In the Orchard' establishes his reputation as an artist
Became a full member of the National Academy of Design
Elected a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences
Died in New Castle, New Hampshire

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Tarbell, at 75 years old, was at the pinnacle of his career, having achieved recognition for his unique Impressionist style and his contributions to the Boston School of painting. He was a renowned teacher and had a deep understanding of art and its historical context. His work had gained considerable acclaim, and he had a well-established reputation as an artist of his time.
title: Edmund Charles Tarbell Self-Portrait
name: Edmund Charles Tarbell

description: Edwin Thomas Booth is a renowned 19th-century American actor celebrated for his Shakespearean performances, most notably as Hamlet.

mainEvents.description: Made his stage debut in Boston.
First appearance in New York City.
His father, Junius Brutus Booth, died.
Achieved international acclaim on a world tour.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Edwin Booth, already established as a leading actor, was managing the Winter Garden Theatre in New York City and staging Shakespearean tragedies.
title: Edwin Booth
name: Edwin Thomas Booth

description: Edwin Forrest is a celebrated American Shakespearean actor best known for his powerful portrayals and his controversial rivalry with British actor William Macready, which resulted in the deadly Astor Place Riot of 1849.

mainEvents.description: Starred as Othello in New York City

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1840 seems to capture the moment when Edwin Forrest was at the peak of his acting career, having achieved significant success in New York and across America with his powerful performances. He had already established himself as a leading Shakespearean actor and was gaining national recognition.
title: Edwin Forrest
name: Edwin Forrest

description: Benjamin West is a prominent 18th- and 19th-century English painter known for his historical scenes, including The Death of General Wolfe, The Death of Nelson, and The Treaty of Paris. He was a founding member of the Royal Academy and rose to become its president, significantly influencing art in England and America.

mainEvents.description: Painting of "The Death of General Wolfe"
Appointed Historical Painter to the Court
Elected President of the Royal Academy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1770 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin West was gaining recognition as a prominent artist, having recently completed his famous work, "The Death of General Wolfe", and being in the midst of a successful career, enjoying the patronage of King George III.
title: Benjamin West
name: Benjamin West

description: Van Wyck Brooks is a renowned American literary critic, biographer, and historian best known for his series 'Makers and Finders,' which chronicled the development of American literature in the 19th century. He won the Pulitzer Prize for History in 1937 for 'The Flowering of New England.'

mainEvents.description: Featured on the cover of 'Time' Magazine

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1909 seems to capture the moment when Van Wyck Brooks was on the cusp of his literary career, having just graduated from Harvard and published his first book of poetry. He was about to embark on a path that would make him one of the most influential American literary critics of his time.
title: Van Wyck Brooks
name: Van Wyck Brooks

description: Gen. George Rogers Clark is a significant figure in American history, known for his military campaigns during the Revolutionary War, particularly his conquest of the Illinois Country, earning him the nickname 'Conqueror of the Old Northwest'.

Led militia forces in the opening engagements of the Northwest Indian War

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1810 seems to capture the moment when Gen. George Rogers Clark, despite facing financial difficulties and health issues, was still revered for his wartime achievements and remained a prominent figure in the Western frontier.

name: Gen. George Rogers Clark

description: Albert James Myer is a renowned United States Army general, known as the father of the U.S. Army Signal Corps, the inventor of wig-wag signaling, and the father of the U.S. Weather Bureau.

Appointed as U.S. Army assistant surgeon
Appointed as Chief Signal Officer and Signal Corps established
Commissioned as Brigadier General in the Regular Army

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1876 seems to capture the moment when Albert James Myer, already a seasoned veteran of the Civil War and founder of the Signal Corps, was overseeing the fledgling U.S. Weather Bureau, a new responsibility that would solidify his legacy.

name: Albert James Myer

description: John Rutledge is a prominent American Founding Father, jurist, and politician who served as an associate justice and the second chief justice of the Supreme Court. He was also the first president of South Carolina and its first governor following the Declaration of Independence.

mainEvents.description: John Rutledge born in Charleston, SC
John Rutledge served in Stamp Act Congress
John Rutledge served as President of South Carolina
John Rutledge served as Governor of South Carolina
John Rutledge served as Associate Justice of the Supreme Court
John Rutledge served as Chief Justice of the Supreme Court
John Rutledge died in Charleston, SC

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1791 seems to capture the moment when John Rutledge was at the height of his career. After serving as governor of South Carolina during the Revolutionary War, he had recently completed his term as an associate justice on the Supreme Court and was likely contemplating his future in public life, which would soon lead him back to the Supreme Court, this time as Chief Justice.
title: John Rutledge
name: John Rutledge

description: King Camp Gillette is a renowned American businessman best known for inventing the disposable safety razor, revolutionizing the shaving industry and establishing a business model that continues to this day.

mainEvents.description: Born in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin
Founded the American Safety Razor Company
Company's name changed to Gillette Safety Razor Company
Production of the safety razor began

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when King Camp Gillette was at the pinnacle of his success, having established the Gillette Safety Razor Company as a major force in the global market.
title: King Camp Gillette
name: King Camp Gillette

description: Thomas Jonathan Jackson is a Confederate general, known for his strict discipline, audacious maneuvers, and deep religious faith, nicknamed "Stonewall" for his stand at First Bull Run.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1862 seems to capture the moment when Jackson, having emerged victorious from the Valley Campaign, was at the height of his military fame and was poised to become a key figure in Lee's Army of Northern Virginia.
title: Stonewall Jackson

description: Enoch Crosby is a significant figure in American Revolutionary War history, known for his daring espionage work during the conflict. His life was an inspiration for the character Harvey Birch in James Fenimore Cooper's novel "The Spy."

Became a spy for the Continental Army
Served as a spy in various locations
Purchased a farm with his brother after the war
Died in Putnam County, New York

title: Enoch Crosby
name: Enoch Crosby

description: Thayendanegea is a Mohawk military and political leader who rose to prominence due to his education, abilities, and connections to British officials. He fought for the British during the American Revolution, becoming a skilled partisan leader known as "Monster Brant", and later helped establish a new home for the Iroquois in what is now Canada.

mainEvents.description: Fought in the Seven Years' War on the side of the British.
Fought against the American rebels in the American Revolutionary War.
Helped establish the Six Nations Reserve in Upper Canada.
Wounded fighting against General George Rogers Clark's expedition.
Signed the Treaty of Fort Stanwix.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in early 19th century, after 1806 original seems to capture the moment when Thayendanegea, now in his later years, reflects on his accomplishments, including leading the Mohawk to a new home in Upper Canada and his successful efforts to unite the Iroquois in resisting American expansion, while also facing the disappointment of a war lost and the loss of his home in the Mohawk Valley.
title: Thayendanegea (Joseph Brant)
name: Thayendanegea

description: Benjamin Strong is a prominent American banker who served as Governor of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York from 1914 until his death in 1928, wielding significant influence over the US and European financial policies.

title: Benjamin Strong
name: Benjamin Strong

Instrumental in developing the Ohio State Meteorological Service

description: Herbert Clark Hoover is a prominent figure in American history, known for his role in international relief efforts during World War I, his service as Secretary of Commerce, and his presidency during the Great Depression.

name: Jacob Jennings Brown

description: Collis Potter Huntington is a prominent American industrialist and railway magnate, known for his role in the development of the first transcontinental railroad and various other major interstate lines.

Huntington was a key figure in the Chesapeake & Ohio Railway's completion.

description: Benjamin O'Fallon is a prominent figure in the history of the American West, known for his role as an Indian agent, fur trader, and advocate for American interests in the Missouri River region. His later years were marked by deteriorating health and financial difficulties, but this portrait likely reflects a time of accomplishment and confidence.

description: Thomas Stone is a prominent American Founding Father, lawyer, and planter who signed the Declaration of Independence and later worked on the Articles of Confederation.

description: Stephen Van Rensselaer III is a prominent figure in early American history, known for his vast landholdings, political career, and philanthropy. He was a Federalist politician, serving in the New York State Assembly, Senate, and as Lieutenant Governor. He also represented New York in the US House of Representatives.
